content.description: Sit start matched on the right facing side-pull rail and toss up and left to gain a nice feeling comfortable pinch and find a heel hook. Move right into a great right facing jug. Move up to top out.
content.location: This is on the far left portion of the downhill facing face of the boulder, to the left of the close trees.

content.description: This problem is below the middle notch on the left facing flat rail. Find the in-cut portion of the left facing rail and use it for a sit start. Also use and upper jug on the right arête formed by the left side of the right face. Move right and up the right arête to climb into the top out of "400 Club".
content.location: When looking at the boulder, you will notice a very large notch in the middle boulder, forming a left and right face.

content.description:
The 400th boulder problem in Grayson Highlands State Park. 

  Sit start on the thin rail and make big moves up the overhanging face to flat edges and slopey holds. Climb straight up the face to a tricky top out portion leading to far off good hands. 

  Small, obscure, and probably not at all worth your time unless you are trying to hike and explore GHSP while also climbing lowball obscura. Bring brushes, as these lines dont get any traffic aside from the occasional intrepid explorer.
content.location: When looking at the boulder, you will notice a very large notch in the middle boulder, forming a left and right face. This problem is on the right overhanging face.

content.description:
Small, obscure, and probably not at all worth your time unless you are trying to hike and explore GHSP while also climbing lowball obscura. Bring brushes, as these lines dont get any traffic aside from the occasional intrepid explorer. 

  The Chronicle Boulder is a small boulder in the Right Boneyard area of the Boneyard. It is above and along the fence line that the Constant Boulder is beside, and the fence line is the border line of the Boneyard. 

  The Chronic Boulder is low but overhanging. It has one super fun v1 line that in called "Chronicles" and then it also has the 400th problem of GHSP called "400 club"... this boulder is fun to visit when in the area.
